Package ohos.ivihardware

Class Vehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.Vehicle

  • public class Vehicle
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides interfaces for vehicle service connectivity.

    You need to call the connect method in this class to connect to a service (such as the vehicle control, T-Box, Cluster, and ADAS) before invoking any interfaces on that particular service. Otherwise, the interface invocations will fail.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static void connect​(VehicleServiceName serviceName,
                           ServiceConnectionListener listener)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Connects to a vehicle service, such as vehicle control, T-Box, Cluster, and ADAS.

        Example code for connecting to a specific vehicle service: 

         ServiceConnectionListener listener = new ServiceConnectionListener() {
     @Override
     public void onServiceConnected(VehicleServiceName serviceName) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onServiceDisconnected(VehicleServiceName serviceName) {
     }
 };
 try {
     Vehicle.connect(VehicleServiceName.VEHICLECONTROL_SERVICE, listener);
 } catch (IllegalStateException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Indicates the name of the vehicle service to connect to.
        listener - Indicates the callback object for a successful or failed service connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the vehicle service is being connected or has been connected.
        Since:
        3

      • connectSync

        public static void connectSync​(VehicleServiceName serviceName)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException,
                               ohos.rpc.RemoteException
        Connects to a vehicle service, such as vehicle control, T-Box, Cluster, and ADAS.

        Example code for connecting to a specific vehicle service: 

         try {
     Vehicle.connect(VehicleServiceName.VEHICLECONTROL_SERVICE);
 } catch (IllegalStateException | RemoteException | InterruptedException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Indicates the name of the vehicle service to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the vehicle service is being connected or has been connected.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if the vehicle service fails to be connected
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Throws this exception if an interrupt request is received
        Since:
        3

      • disconnect

        public static void disconnect​(VehicleServiceName serviceName)
        Disconnects from a vehicle service, such as vehicle control, T-Box, Cluster, and ADAS.

        Example code for disconnecting from a specific vehicle service: 

         Vehicle.disconnect(VehicleServiceName.VEHICLECONTROL_SERVICE);
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Indicates the name of the vehicle service to disconnect from.
        Since:
        3

      • isConnected

        public static boolean isConnected​(VehicleServiceName serviceName)
        Checks whether a vehicle service (such as vehicle control, T-Box, Cluster, and ADAS) has been connected.

        Example code for checking whether a specific vehicle service has been connected: 

         Vehicle.isConnected(VehicleServiceName.VEHICLECONTROL_SERVICE);
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Indicates the name of the vehicle service.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vehicle service has been connected; returns otherwise.
        Since:
        3
